questions.question: "Regret" means...

choices.answer: To be happy about a past event.
To be sad about something.
To feel sorrow or remorse for something.
A sense of dissatisfaction.

questions.question: To talk about regrets we use the structure:

choices.answer: Should have
Should + verb in the simple past
Should + verb in the past participle
Should have + verb in the past participle

questions.question: It's an example of a sentence expressing regret:

choices.answer: I should have ate faster.
I should have bring a coat.
I should have listen to mom.
I should have studied more.

questions.question: It's an example of a sentence expressing regret:

choices.answer: I shouldn't have eaten so fast.
I shouldn't have listen to Julie.
I shouldn't have talk to him.
I shouldn't have drive so fast.

questions.question: to create negative sentences talking about regrets, the structure is:

choices.answer: Should have not
Should not have
Shouldn't have
Should haven't

questions.question: You had a terrible fight with a friend. Now you regret. the correct sentence is:

choices.answer: I should have be more patient.
I shouldn't have yelled to him.
I should talked to him.
I should have call him.

questions.question: You want to eat popcorn but you forgot to buy it on the supermarket. Now you regret...

choices.answer: I should have gone to the supermarket.
I should have go to the supermarket.
I should go to the supermarket.
I should have went to the supermarket.

questions.question: You bought a very expensive smartphone and now you regret it.

choices.answer: I should have buy a cheaper one.
I shouldn't have buy this smartphone.
I should have bought a cheaper one.
I shouldn't bought this smartphone.

questions.question: You fought with your mother because you were in a bad mood.

choices.answer: I should have be so moody.
I shouldn't have been so moody.
I should have was so moody.
I shouldn't have was so moody.

questions.question: You spend a lot of money on video games and now you can't buy a bike.

choices.answer: I shouldn't have been so sensitive.
I shouldn't have been so intuitive.
I shouldn't have been so amusing.
I shouldn't have been so impulsive.

questions.question: You had an argument with your friend because of a stupid thing.

choices.answer: I shouldn't have been so childish.
I should have been more helpful.
I should have been more loving.
I shouldn't have been so easygoing.

questions.question: You told your best friend she is really, really fat and now she is depressed.

choices.answer: I should have been more charming.
I should have been brighter.
I should have been inconsiderate.
I should have been more sensible.

questions.question: Your friend needed your help to finish the math activities but you said no.

choices.answer: I should have been more narrow-minded.
I should have help my friend.
I shouldn't have been more helpful.
I should have helped my friend.

questions.question: It's your prom and you don't have a date to go to the party.

choices.answer: I shouldn't have be so easygoing.
I should have invite someone earlier.
I should have been more sociable.
I shouldn't have been so romantic.

questions.question: All of your friends are hanging out, except you 'cause your have to finish your homework.

choices.answer: I should have finished my homework yesterday.
I shoudn't have been hanging out.
I should have been more irresponsible.
I should have been less bright.

questions.question: I failed the test because I didn't finish the weblessons.

choices.answer: I should have finished the weblessons before the test.
I should have finished the weblessons before the test.
I should have finished the weblessons before the test.
I should have finished the weblessons before the test.

questions.question: The English homework deadline is over and I haven't handed them to the teacher.

choices.answer: I should have finished the homework.
I should have finished the homework.
I should have finished the homework.
I should have finished the homework.

questions.question: The summer is coming and I haven't lost weight.

choices.answer: I should have been more optimistic.
I should have been on a diet.
I should have eaten more.
I should have been more sarcastic.

questions.question: I have to get to the restaurant at 7 pm, but the traffic is terrible and I won't make it.

choices.answer: I should have call my husband.
I should have leave earlier.
I should have called my husband.
I should have been more intuitive.

questions.question: I'm going on a travel to Canada, but I have just realized that my visa has expired a month ago.

choices.answer: I should have check earlier.
I shouldn't have been so responsible.
I should have checked earlier.
I should have traveling a month ago.
